verses.verse: And it came<WH1961> to pass after<WH310> this,<WH3651> that Absalom<WH53> prepared<WH6213> him chariots<WH4818> and horses,<WH5483> and fifty<WH2572> men<WH376> to run<WH7323> before<WH6440> him.

And Absalom<WH53> rose<WH7925> up early,<WH7925> and stood beside<WH5921> <WH3027> the way<WH1870> of the gate:<WH8179> and it was so, that when any<WH3605> man<WH376> that had<WH1961> a controversy<WH7379> came<WH935> to the king<WH4428> for judgment,<WH4941> then Absalom<WH53> called<WH7121> to him, and said,<WH559> Of what<WH4310> city<WH5892> are you? And he said,<WH559> Your servant<WH5650> is of one<WH259> of the tribes<WH7626> of Israel.<WH3478>
And Absalom<WH53> said<WH559> to him, See,<WH7200> your matters<WH1697> are good<WH2896> and right;<WH5228> but there is no<WH369> man deputed of the king<WH4428> to hear<WH8085> you.

Absalom<WH53> said<WH559> moreover, Oh that I were made<WH7760> judge<WH8199> in the land,<WH776> that every<WH3605> man<WH376> which<WH834> has any suit<WH7379> or cause<WH4941> might come<WH935> to me, and I would do him justice!<WH6663>
And it was so, that when any man<WH376> came<WH7126> near<WH7126> to him to do him obeisance,<WH7812> he put<WH7971> forth<WH7971> his hand,<WH3027> and took<WH2388> him, and kissed<WH5401> him.

And on this<WH2088> manner<WH1697> did<WH6213> Absalom<WH53> to all<WH3605> Israel<WH3478> that came<WH935> to the king<WH4428> for judgment:<WH4941> so Absalom<WH53> stole<WH1589> the hearts<WH3820> of the men<WH582> of Israel.<WH3478>

And it came<WH1961> to pass after<WH7093> forty<WH705> years,<WH8141> that Absalom<WH53> said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> I pray<WH4994> you, let me go<WH3212> and pay<WH7999> my vow,<WH5088> which<WH834> I have vowed<WH5087> to the LORD,<WH3068> in Hebron.<WH2275>

For your servant<WH5650> vowed<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> while I stayed<WH3427> at Geshur<WH1650> in Syria,<WH758> saying,<WH559> If<WH518> the LORD<WH3068> shall bring<WH7725> me again<WH7725> indeed to Jerusalem,<WH3389> then I will serve<WH5647> the LORD.<WH3068>
And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to him, Go<WH3212> in peace.<WH7965> So he arose,<WH6965> and went<WH3212> to Hebron.<WH2275>

But Absalom<WH53> sent<WH7971> spies<WH7270> throughout all<WH3605> the tribes<WH7626> of Israel,<WH3478> saying,<WH559> As soon as you hear<WH8085> the sound<WH6963> of the trumpet,<WH7782> then you shall say,<WH559> Absalom<WH53> reigns<WH4427> in Hebron.<WH2275>

And with Absalom<WH53> went<WH1980> two hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> out of Jerusalem,<WH3389> that were called;<WH7121> and they went<WH1980> in their simplicity,<WH8537> and they knew<WH3045> not any<WH3605> thing.<WH1697>

And Absalom<WH53> sent<WH7971> for Ahithophel<WH302> the Gilonite,<WH1526> David's<WH1732> counselor,<WH3289> from his city,<WH5892> even from Giloh,<WH1542> while he offered<WH2076> sacrifices.<WH2077> And the conspiracy<WH7195> was strong;<WH533> for the people<WH5971> increased<WH7227> continually<WH1980> with Absalom.<WH53>
And there came<WH935> a messenger<WH5046> to David,<WH1732> saying,<WH559> The hearts<WH3820> of the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> are after<WH310> Absalom.<WH53>

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to all<WH3605> his servants<WH5650> that were with him at Jerusalem,<WH3389> Arise,<WH6965> and let us flee;<WH1272> for we shall not else escape<WH6413> from Absalom:<WH53> make speed<WH4116> to depart,<WH3212> lest<WH6435> he overtake<WH5381> us suddenly,<WH4116> and bring<WH5080> evil<WH7451> on us, and smite<WH5221> the city<WH5892> with the edge<WH6310> of the sword.<WH2719>

And the king's<WH4428> servants<WH5650> said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> Behold,<WH2009> your servants<WH5650> are ready to do whatever<WH3605> <WH834> my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> shall appoint.<WH977>

And the king<WH4428> went<WH3318> forth,<WH3318> and all<WH3605> his household<WH1004> after<WH7272> him. And the king<WH4428> left<WH5800> ten<WH6235> women,<WH802> which<WH834> were concubines,<WH6370> to keep<WH8104> the house.<WH1004>
And the king<WH4428> went<WH3318> forth,<WH3318> and all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> after<WH7272> him, and tarried<WH5975> in a place<WH1004> that was far<WH4801> off.

And all<WH3605> his servants<WH5650> passed<WH5674> on beside<WH5921> <WH3027> him; and all<WH3605> the Cherethites,<WH3774> and all<WH3605> the Pelethites,<WH6432> and all<WH3605> the Gittites,<WH1663> six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> which<WH834> came<WH935> after<WH7272> him from Gath,<WH1661> passed<WH5674> on before<WH5921> <WH6440> the king.<WH4428>

Then said<WH559> the king<WH4428> to Ittai<WH863> the Gittite,<WH1663> Why<WH4100> go<WH3212> you also<WH1571> with us? return<WH7725> to your place,<WH4725> and abide<WH3427> with the king:<WH4428> for you are a stranger,<WH5237> and also<WH1571> an exile.<WH1540>

Whereas you came<WH935> but yesterday,<WH8543> should I this day<WH3117> make you go<WH3212> up and down<WH5128> with us? seeing I go<WH1980> where<WH5921> <WH834> I may, return<WH7725> you, and take back<WH7725> your brothers:<WH251> mercy<WH2617> and truth<WH571> be with you.

And Ittai<WH863> answered<WH6030> the king,<WH4428> and said,<WH559> As the LORD<WH3068> lives,<WH2416> and as my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> lives,<WH2416> surely<WH3588> in what<WH834> place<WH4725> my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> shall be, whether<WH518> in death<WH4194> or life,<WH2416> even<WH3588> there<WH8033> also will your servant<WH5650> be.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Ittai,<WH863> Go<WH3212> and pass<WH5674> over.<WH5674> And Ittai<WH863> the Gittite<WH1663> passed<WH5674> over,<WH5674> and all<WH3605> his men,<WH582> and all<WH3605> the little<WH2945> ones that were with him.

And all<WH3605> the country<WH776> wept<WH1058> with a loud<WH1419> voice,<WH6963> and all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> passed<WH5674> over:<WH5674> the king<WH4428> also himself passed<WH5674> over<WH5674> the brook<WH5158> Kidron,<WH6939> and all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> passed<WH5674> over,<WH5674> toward<WH5921> <WH6440> the way<WH1870> of the wilderness.<WH4057>

And see<WH2009> Zadok<WH6659> also,<WH1571> and all<WH3605> the Levites<WH3881> were with him, bearing<WH5375> the ark<WH727> of the covenant<WH1285> of God:<WH430> and they set<WH3332> down<WH3332> the ark<WH727> of God;<WH430> and Abiathar<WH54> went<WH5927> up, until<WH5704> all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> had done<WH8552> passing<WH5674> out of the city.<WH5892>

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> to Zadok,<WH6659> Carry<WH7725> back<WH7725> the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> into the city:<WH5892> if<WH518> I shall find<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in the eyes<WH5869> of the LORD,<WH3068> he will bring<WH7725> me again,<WH7725> and show<WH7200> me both it, and his habitation:<WH5116>
But if<WH518> he thus<WH3541> say,<WH559> I have no<WH3808> delight<WH2654> in you; behold,<WH2005> here am I, let him do<WH6213> to me as seems<WH5869> good<WH2896> to him.

The king<WH4428> said<WH559> also to Zadok<WH6659> the priest,<WH3548> Are not you a seer?<WH7200> return<WH7725> into the city<WH5892> in peace,<WH7965> and your two<WH8147> sons<WH1121> with you, Ahimaaz<WH290> your son,<WH1121> and Jonathan<WH3083> the son<WH1121> of Abiathar.<WH54>
See,<WH7200> I will tarry<WH4102> in the plain<WH6160> of the wilderness,<WH4057> until<WH5704> there come<WH935> word<WH1697> from you to certify<WH5046> me.
Zadok<WH6659> therefore and Abiathar<WH54> carried<WH7725> the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> again<WH7725> to Jerusalem:<WH3389> and they tarried<WH3427> there.<WH8033>

And David<WH1732> went<WH5927> up by the ascent<WH4608> of mount Olivet,<WH2132> and wept<WH1058> as he went<WH5927> up, and had his head<WH7218> covered,<WH2645> and he went<WH1980> barefoot:<WH3182> and all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> that was with him covered<WH2645> every man<WH376> his head,<WH7218> and they went<WH5927> up, weeping<WH1058> as they went<WH5927> up.

And one told<WH5046> David,<WH1732> saying,<WH559> Ahithophel<WH302> is among the conspirators<WH7194> with Absalom.<WH53> And David<WH1732> said,<WH559> O LORD,<WH3068> I pray<WH4994> you, turn the counsel<WH6098> of Ahithophel<WH302> into foolishness.<WH5528>

And it came<WH1961> to pass, that when David<WH1732> was come<WH935> to the top<WH7218> of the mount, where<WH834> <WH8033> he worshipped<WH7812> God,<WH430> behold,<WH2009> Hushai<WH2365> the Archite<WH757> came to meet<WH7125> him with his coat<WH3801> rent,<WH7167> and earth<WH127> on his head:<WH7218>
To whom David<WH1732> said,<WH559> If<WH518> you pass<WH5674> on with me, then you shall be a burden<WH4853> to me:

But if<WH518> you return<WH7725> to the city,<WH5892> and say<WH559> to Absalom,<WH53> I will be your servant,<WH5650> O king;<WH4428> as I have been<WH1961> your father's<WH1> servant<WH5650> till now,<WH227> so will I now<WH6258> also be your servant:<WH5650> then may you for me defeat<WH6565> the counsel<WH6098> of Ahithophel.<WH302>

And have you not there<WH8033> with you Zadok<WH6659> and Abiathar<WH54> the priests?<WH3548> therefore it shall be, that what<WH3605> thing<WH1697> soever<WH834> you shall hear<WH8085> out of the king's<WH4428> house,<WH1004> you shall tell<WH5046> it to Zadok<WH6659> and Abiathar<WH54> the priests.<WH3548>

Behold,<WH2009> they have there<WH8033> with them their two<WH8147> sons,<WH1121> Ahimaaz<WH290> Zadok's<WH6659> son, and Jonathan<WH3083> Abiathar's<WH54> son; and by them you shall send<WH7971> to me every<WH3605> thing<WH1697> that you can hear.<WH8085>
So Hushai<WH2365> David's<WH1732> friend<WH7463> came<WH935> into the city,<WH5892> and Absalom<WH53> came<WH935> into Jerusalem.<WH3389>
